alert.note: Alert for Wilcox (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wilcox County through 545 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Rochelle to near Abba, and moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Rochelle, Browning, Cedar Creek, Antioch Church, Owensboro and Pope City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
